Race and organizations,
and integration more broadly,

is one of the biggest problems that
has shaped U.S. businesses historically

that is important for business
leaders to think about.

Thinking long-term, companies should
recognize that demographics are changing,
and that there is in the general population

large support for the idea of
inclusion in the workplace.

A lot of companies are pulling back
from their sort of splashy PR campaigns

that happened in the wake
of George Floyd's murder,

but they're not pulling
back as much on policies

that are effective
day-to-day in the workplace,

because they recognize that diversity is
ultimately beneficial to their business.
It allows them to gain market share,

and it allows them to
recruit and retain talent,
and they don't want to give that up.
